We have a vast collection of artifacts from various periods. Our notable collections include Chola bronzes, temple inscriptions, and ancient Tamil manuscripts.
Our artifacts include pieces from the Chola, Pallava, and Pandya dynasties. Would you like to explore a specific period?
We offer two membership tiers: Basic Explorer (₹999/year) and Kalanjiyam Patron (₹2,499/year). Both include instant artifact feed access.
Our Kalanjiyam Patron membership (₹2,499/year) includes exclusive documentaries, artifact lectures, and behind-the-scenes updates.
You can visit our partner museums in Chennai and Delhi. The National Museum and Madras Museum showcase our finest collections.
Our museum partners offer guided tours and special exhibitions. Would you like information about booking tickets?
Our latest excavations have revealed fascinating artifacts from ancient Tamil civilizations. Members get real-time updates on new discoveries.
Recent excavations have uncovered important historical sites. Would you like to learn more about our findings?
Each artifact in our collection includes details about its period, dynasty, material, and historical significance. You can click on any artifact to see its full details.
Our artifacts are categorized by period, dynasty, and location. Would you like to explore artifacts from a specific era?
You can find detailed information about each artifact including its age, origin, and historical context in our digital gallery.

patterns: Where can I see this artifact
responses: Our artifacts are displayed in partner museums across India, primarily in Chennai and Delhi. You can find the exact location on each artifact's detail page.
The National Museum in Delhi and Madras Museum in Chennai house many of our documented artifacts. Would you like museum visiting information?
Each artifact's location is listed in its details. We can help you plan a visit to see them in person.
You can use our Explore page to search artifacts by period, dynasty, location, or material. Would you like me to show you how?
Our digital gallery allows filtering by various categories including historical period, dynasty, and location.
Try using the search bar on our Explore page, or use filters to narrow down artifacts by period, material, or location.
Members get exclusive access to: 1) Real-time excavation updates 2) Detailed artifact documentation 3) Expert lectures 4) Special museum tours. Basic Explorer starts at ₹999/year.
Our Kalanjiyam Patron members (₹2,499/year) enjoy premium benefits including behind-the-scenes content, expert consultations, and early access to new discoveries.
Membership includes instant artifact feed access, exclusive documentaries, and special museum visit privileges. Would you like to know more about our membership tiers?
To upload a new artifact, use our Upload page. You'll need to provide details like period, dynasty, material, and clear images.
Artifact uploads require authentication. Please ensure you have proper documentation and clear images before submitting.
Visit our Upload section to contribute artifact information. We'll guide you through the documentation process.
Our Tamil heritage collection includes artifacts from the Chola, Pallava, and Pandya dynasties, showcasing rich cultural history spanning over 2000 years.
We have extensive documentation of Tamil Nadu's archaeological heritage, including temple architecture, bronze sculptures, and ancient inscriptions.
Explore our collection of South Indian artifacts, featuring pieces from various Tamil dynasties and historical periods.
We partner with major museums including the National Museum (Delhi) and Government Museum (Chennai). Each offers unique exhibits of our documented artifacts.
Our museum partners provide special access and guided tours for Kalanjiyam members. Would you like information about visiting hours and tickets?
Partner museums showcase our documented artifacts with expert curators available for detailed historical context.
Our artifacts span various periods from ancient Tamil history. Each piece includes detailed dating information on its detail page.
We use scientific methods to date our artifacts. You can find the specific period information in the artifact details.

patterns: What types of artifacts do you have
responses: We have several categories including: 1) Temple Architecture 2) Bronze Sculptures 3) Stone Inscriptions 4) Ancient Coins 5) Pottery 6) Jewelry 7) Manuscripts. Which interests you?

Our collection spans various categories: Temple artifacts, Bronze sculptures, Stone inscriptions, Ancient coins, Pottery, Jewelry, and Palm leaf manuscripts. Would you like to explore any specific category?
Our temple artifacts collection includes architectural elements, sculptures, and ritual objects from various dynasties. Notable pieces include Chola bronze deities and Pallava stone carvings.

We have documented temple artifacts spanning the Pallava, Chola, and Pandya periods. These include architectural fragments, bronze icons, and stone sculptures. Would you like to see specific examples?
Our bronze collection features exquisite pieces from the Chola period, known for their artistic excellence. The collection includes dancing figures, deity statues, and decorative objects.
The bronze artifacts showcase the masterful craftsmanship of ancient Tamil artisans. Many pieces feature the lost-wax casting technique unique to the Chola period.
Our stone inscriptions provide valuable historical information about ancient Tamil society, governance, and culture. Many are written in Tamil-Brahmi and later Tamil scripts.
The inscription collection includes royal edicts, temple records, and land grants. These help us understand the social, economic, and political systems of ancient Tamil Nadu.
Our current excavations are focused on several key sites in Tamil Nadu, including ancient port cities and inland trading centers. Each site reveals new aspects of Tamil heritage.
We're currently excavating at multiple locations that show evidence of ancient Tamil civilization. These sites have yielded pottery, coins, and structural remains.

We use various scientific methods including radiocarbon dating, thermoluminescence, and stratigraphic analysis to date artifacts. Most of our collection ranges from 3rd century BCE to 13th century CE.
Our artifacts are dated using multiple techniques. The oldest pieces in our collection date back to the Sangam period (3rd century BCE to 3rd century CE).
Our digital platform offers: 1) High-resolution 3D scans 2) Virtual tours 3) Detailed artifact documentation 4) Interactive timelines 5) Educational resources. What would you like to explore?
You can explore our collection through virtual tours, 3D models, and detailed digital documentation. Members get access to additional features like expert lectures and behind-the-scenes content.
We welcome research collaborations! Scholars can access our detailed documentation, work with our experts, and contribute to ongoing research projects.
Our research program offers opportunities for scholars to study artifacts, participate in excavations, and contribute to our documentation efforts. Would you like more information?
We employ state-of-the-art conservation techniques to preserve our artifacts. This includes climate control, specialized storage, and regular maintenance by expert conservators.
Our conservation team uses both traditional and modern methods to protect artifacts. Each piece is carefully documented and monitored to ensure its long-term preservation.
